derivation: akin to H3212 (יָלַךְ); a primitive root;
outline:
1. to go, walk, come
    1. (Qal)
      1. to go, walk, come, depart, proceed, move, go away
      2. to die, live, manner of life (fig.)
    2. (Piel)
      1. to walk
      2. to walk (fig.)
    3. (Hithpael)
      1. to traverse
      2. to walk about
    4. (Niphal) to lead, bring, lead away, carry, cause to walk
kjv_def: (all) along, apace, behave (self), come, (on) continually, be conversant, depart, [phrase] be eased, enter, exercise (self), [phrase] follow, forth, forward, get, go (about, abroad, along, away, forward, on, out, up and down), [phrase] greater, grow, be wont to haunt, lead, march, [idiom] more and more, move (self), needs, on, pass (away), be at the point, quite, run (along), [phrase] send, speedily, spread, still, surely, [phrase] tale-bearer, [phrase] travel(-ler), walk (abroad, on, to and fro, up and down, to places), wander, wax, (way-) faring man, [idiom] be weak, whirl.
strongs_def: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
